page.title: 18Local History
page.content: {SETTLEMENT:_ As long ago as the New Stone Age there was a settlement on Muldersleigh Hill. One of the most important developments was the building of the FORD across LARNE LOUGH.{Ballycarry} was derived from{Ballaghkarry}which translated means 'The Town of the Ford'. Today the main settlements are on either side of the ford. {WEST_}Ballycarry's housing developments are at both ends of Main Street on which houses are being renovated, aided by restoration grants. {EAST_}The main residential area is at Ballystrudder and around the Rinkha. Planning permission has been granted for further housing development.
